title: Executive Order 6910-A-Purchase of Forest Lands for Emergency Conservation Work
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me under the Emergency Appropriation Act, fiscal year 1935, approved June 19, 1934 (Title II, Public No. 412, 73d Congress), appropriating $899,675,000 as an additional amount for carrying out the purposes of the Acts enumerated under the above mentioned title, $10,000,000 of the amount heretofore allocated from the said appropriation to the Emergency Conservation Fund shall be transferred by the Treasury Department to the credit of the War Department. The funds herein allocated, upon request of the Chief of Finance, under direction of the Director of Emergency Conservation Work, shall be transferred by the Treasury to the credit of the Department of Agriculture, and the funds so transferred shall be for withdrawal on requisition by the Secretary of Agriculture as an additional amount to carry out the purposes of the Executive Order of July 21, 1933 (No. 6208), and tho Executive Order of June 30, 1934 (No. 6787).
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6910-A-Purchase of Forest Lands for Emergency Conservation Work Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/373450
